title: Why Lab Results Take Time
summary: A calm, step-by-step explanation of what actually happens between collection and a final result — and why delays don’t mean neglect.

title: Why Recollection Happens (And Why It’s Not About Blame)
summary: Recollection is often the safest choice. Here’s the reasoning — hemolysis, contamination risk, and specimen integrity.

title: Reference Ranges vs Physiology: “Normal” Isn’t a Personality Trait
summary: Why reference ranges are population tools, not guarantees — and how biology, timing, and context shape interpretation.
